With an order, the governor of Basilicata , Vito Bardi, has placed the mandatory quarantine for anyone arriving from the northern regions affected by the Coronavirus infection. Before entering Basilicata, they will have to stay in solitary confinement or at home for 14 days.

Surveillance and risk communication

Travel advice (avoid touching poultry/birds or their droppings; avoid visiting wet markets, live poultry markets or farms; avoid making close contact with patients, especially those with symptoms of acute respiratory infections;adhere to food safety and hygiene rules such as avoiding consuming raw or undercooked animal products, including milk, eggs and meat, or foods which may be contaminated by animal secretions, excretions (such as urine) or contaminated products, unless they have been properly cooked, washed or peeled)
Risk communication (to address public concern and to increase transparency, the Government will daily announce the number of cases meeting enhanced surveillance)

Isolation, Surveillance and risk communication (if a suspected case is identified, frontline healthcare staff should send the patient to airborne infection isolation room for treatment with urgent laboratory investigation; and to inform the Centre for Health Protection (CHP) of the DH and the headquarters of HA)

Temperature screening was implemented to all inbound travellers on flights arriving from Wuhan
Temperature screening was expanded to all inbound travellers on flights arriving from China
MOH has initiated contact tracing.
MOH advises travellers to avoid non-essential travel to Wuhan.
MOH advises travellers to avoid non-essential travel to mainland China.
All new visitors with recent travel history to Hubei Province, China within the last 14 days will not be allowed entry into Singapore, or transit through Singapore.
All new visitors with recent travel history to mainland China within the last 14 days will not be allowed entry into Singapore, or transit through Singapore.
All new visitors with recent travel history to Daegu and Cheongdo, Republic of Korea, within the last 14 days will not be allowed entry into Singapore, or transit through Singapore.

Schools will be adopting additional measures to lower the risk of transmission among students and staff, including staggered recesses and suspension of school assemblies. Preschools will limit the number of visitors to their premises.
Daily health checks at the workplace
MOH will be implementing temperature screening and closer controls of entry points into the hospitals.
Social/eldercare services will limit the number of visitors to their premises.
Singapore implemented a 14-day “Stay-Home Notice” (SHN) for all travellers returning from mainland China (outside of Hubei) who are Singapore residents or long-term pass holders.
Singapore implemented a 14-day leave of absence (LOA) for all travellers returning from mainland China (outside of Hubei) who are Singapore residents or long-term pass holders.

The Department of Disease Control (DDC), Ministry of Public Health (MOPH), Thailand scaled up the Emergency Operations Center to Level 3 to closely monitor the ongoing situation both at the national and international levels.
The Travel Alert for the coronavirus outbreak was raised to Level 3. The MOPH recommends that travelers avoid all non-essential travel to outbreak areas.

Several universities and government instituitions announced guidelines for travel safety to Republic of Korea (South Korea), the People's Republic of China, Macao Special Administrative Region of the People's Republic of China,  Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People's Republic of China, Japan, Republic of China (Taiwan), Malaysia, the Socialist Republic of Vietnam and Republic of Singapore during the COVID-19 outbreak
Health officials were given the legal authority to test, treat and quarantine people infected with COVID-19 as well as high risk contacts if needed.
The Ministry of Public Health is also requesting students to consider cancel or postpone gatherings and rallies as part of broad measures to promote social distancing.
Travellers returning from affected areas should be in a separate bedroom, stay at home and not go to the community or public place for at least 14 days after returning to Thailand.
